oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Organic labbeling systems and consumer confidence
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sønderskov, Kim Mannemar
Daugbjerg, Carsten
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Regulation
Food systems
Consumer issues
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A research analysis suggests that a state certification and labelling system creates confidence in organic labelling systems and consequently green consumerism. Danish consumers have higher levels of confidence in the labelling system than consumers in countries where the state plays a minor role in labelling and certification.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Sønderskov, Kim Mannemar and Daugbjerg, Carsten (2009) Organic labbeling systems and consumer confidence. ICROFS news, 2009, pp. 2-4.
